decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces necessary to win the game through a single turn win condition using Ad Nauseam. By utilizing cards like Spoils of the Vault, Angel's Grace, and Phyrexian Unlife, the deck aims to draw its entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle by ensuring it is the last card in the library. The deck also includes cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to ramp up mana quickly, allowing for a faster combo execution. The deck focuses on consistency and speed to achieve its win condition efficiently.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive pace, using low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on efficient removal and burn spells like Lightning Helix, Lightning Bolt, and Rift Bolt, along with creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of low-cost permanents. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of damage.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifacts and land synergies to control the game while generating card advantage. It relies on cards like Mishra's Bauble and Arcum's Astrolabe to cycle through the deck, while using Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to control the opponent's board. Urza, Lord High Artificer provides additional mana and card advantage, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath gains life and draws cards. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can recur artifacts from the graveyard, creating a powerful engine. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out victories through superior resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing a diverse array of mana sources to cast powerful multicolored spells, including the titular Niv-Mizzet Reborn. It aims to control the game through cards like Thoughtseize, Assassin's Trophy, and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also generating value through cards like Bring to Light and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The inclusion of Wrenn and Six provides additional card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around efficiently casting powerful spells and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively and utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat. It includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald to set up efficiently while using discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck incorporates removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board and creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to apply pressure. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value by allowing the player to recur important creatures and spells from the graveyard.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. With a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to dictate the pace of the game and grind out advantages over time. Utilizing cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage. The mana base is optimized for flexibility and consistency in casting spells of multiple colors.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Key components include efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with a plethora of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while also utilizing cards like Seal of Fire and Grim Lavamancer to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win quickly and decisively before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den to provide additional value and flexibility. The mana base is carefully constructed to allow for easy access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck. Key cards like Snapcaster Mage, Wrenn and Six, and Ice-Fang Coatl provide additional value and versatility in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's pace and outvalue the opponent through efficient card choices and strategic play.

This Modern Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to bring back low-cost threats and disrupt opponents with a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kroxa. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Scavenging Ooze and seal the deal with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. Wrenn and Six provide additional value by recurring lands and dealing damage over time. The deck's game plan revolves around applying pressure early on and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers, extra turn effects, and efficient card draw. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through cards like Wrenn and Six and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. By combining control elements like counterspells and bounce effects with win conditions like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Chandra, Torch of Defiance, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy game.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting opponents with targeted removal and hand disruption spells. Its key strength lies in its efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, supported by versatile spells like Kolaghan's Command and Assassin's Trophy. The deck aims to apply early pressure while maintaining card advantage and controlling the board with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Scavenging Ooze. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an additional recursion strategy to ensure the deck has staying power in longer games.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard to gain value and disrupt opponents, while applying constant pressure on the board with efficient and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Hexdrinker. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Assassin's Trophy, along with graveyard hate like Nihil Spellbomb. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard, making this deck a versatile and aggressive choice for the Modern format.

This deck focuses on control through counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue opponents. By efficiently controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategy, it aims to gain incremental advantages until it can secure the win. With a mix of versatile spells and powerful threats like Snapcaster Mage and Archmage's Charm, this deck aims to maintain control of the game and dictate the pace to emerge victorious. Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly burning through the opponent's life total using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. It also includes synergistic cards like Seal of Fire and Mishra's Bauble to maintain pressure and card advantage. The main strategy is to apply constant pressure while removing blockers and finishing off the opponent with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, provides additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost permanents from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on a strategy that involves playing aggressively with efficient threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and hand disruption. It aims to control the board and tempo of the game using a combination of creatures like Delver of Secrets and Snapcaster Mage, along with powerful spells like Archmage's Charm and Fatal Push. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recast important cards from the graveyard. The deck's mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of Human creatures that work well together to create a powerful aggressive strategy. The key concept is to quickly build up a strong board presence with cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play while cards like Reflector Mage and Mantis Rider provide additional utility and pressure. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and versatile lineup of Human creatures.
